UnableToApplyGlamourPlatesHere: Glamour plates cannot be applied in this area.

TimeAgo.Format.Short: Short countdown to the designated time.

Markers.AetherCurrents.Name: Aether Currents
Markers.AetherCurrents.Description: Shows world markers for any nearby Aether Currents in the current zone.
Markers.PartyMembers.Name: Party Members
Markers.PartyMembers.Description: Shows world markers for your party members that are far away from you but in the same map.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.ShowIcon.Des: Whether to show the party member icons on the world markers.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.ShowName.Des: Whether to show the party member names on the world markers.
Markers.PartyMembers.Config.IconType.Des: The type of icon that is used on the world marker. Only applicable if 'Show party member icons' is enabled.
Markers.EurekaCoffers.Name: Eureka Bunny Coffers
Markers.EurekaCoffers.Description: Shows world markers for the Bunny Coffers in the Eureka zones after you've used the Lucky Carrot item.
Markers.EurekaCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.N: Enable map markers for detected coffers
Markers.EurekaCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.D: Adds map markers for detected Eureka Bunny Coffer locations. Note that this feature is unavailable if the Eureka Linker plugin is also installed and enabled, since it also provides similar functionality.
Markers.OccultCoffers.Name: Occult Crescent Pot Coffers
Markers.OccultCoffers.Description: Shows world markers for the Pot Coffers in the Occult Crescent zones after you've used the Magical Elixir item.
Markers.OccultCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.N: Enable map markers for detected coffers
Markers.OccultCoffers.EnableMapMarkers.D: Adds map markers for detected Occult Crescent Pot Coffer locations. Note that this feature is unavailable if the Eureka Linker plugin is also installed and enabled, since it also provides similar functionality.
Markers.Occult.SurveyPoints.Name: Occult Survey Points
Markers.Occult.SurveyPoints.Description: Shows world markers for the occult survey points in the current zone. Note that markers of this type are only drawn when the player is within 100 yalms of the survey point.
Markers.Fate.Name: FATE Markers
Markers.Fate.Description: Shows world markers for the active FATEs in the current zone.
Markers.Flag.Name: Flag Marker
Markers.Flag.Description: Shows a world marker for the placed flag in the current zone.
Markers.GatheringNodes.Name: Gathering Node Markers
Markers.GatheringNodes.Description: Shows world markers for the active gathering nodes around you.
Markers.GatheringNodes.ShowContents.Name: Show node contents
Markers.GatheringNodes.ShowContents.Desc: Shows the contents of the gathering nodes on the markers.
Markers.Hunt.Name: Hunt Markers
Markers.Hunt.Description: Shows world markers for the B/A/S/SS-rank mobs in the current zone.
Markers.MapLink.Name: Adjacent Area Markers
Markers.MapLink.Description: Shows markers for locations to adjacent and instanced areas.
Markers.MapLink.ShowAreaBoundaries.Name: Show area boundaries
Markers.MapLink.ShowAreaBoundaries.Descr: Shows markers to the map boundaries to adjacent areas.
Markers.MapLink.ShowInstanceEntries.Name: Show instance entries
Markers.MapLink.ShowInstanceEntries.Desc: Shows markers for instance entries that are in the current zone.
Markers.MapLink.ShowAetherytes.Name: Show aetherytes
Markers.MapLink.ShowAetherytes.Descripti: Shows markers for aetherytes that are in the current zone.
Markers.MapLink.ShowAethernetShards.Name: Show aethernet shards
Markers.MapLink.ShowAethernetShards.Desc: Shows markers for aethernet shards that are in the current zone.
Markers.MapLink.ShowChocoboPorters.Name: Show chocobo porters
Markers.MapLink.ShowChocoboPorters.Descr: Shows markers for chocobo porters that are in the current zone.
Markers.MapLink.ShowFerryDocks.Name: Show ferry docks and airships
Markers.MapLink.ShowFerryDocks.Descripti: Shows markers for ferry docks and airships that are in the current zone.
Markers.Quest.Name: Quest Objective Markers
Markers.Quest.Description: Shows world markers for objectives of active quests in the current zone.
Markers.Quest.ShowMapLinkMarkers.Name: Show teleport markers
Markers.Quest.ShowMapLinkMarkers.Descrip: Shows markers for quest objectives that point to an NPC or object that teleports you to an adjacent area.
Markers.Quest.ShowBluePendingQuests.Name: Show available feature quests
Markers.Quest.ShowBluePendingQuests.Desc: Shows markers for feature (blue) quests that are available but not yet accepted.
Include feature quests that are unavailable due to level, job or other requirements (red icons).
Markers.TreasureCoffer.Name: Treasure Coffer Markers
Markers.TreasureCoffer.Description: Shows world markers for the treasure coffers that are near you.
Markers.TripleTriad.Name: Triple Triad Card Markers
Markers.TripleTriad.Description: Shows world markers for unobtained Triple Triad cards in the current zone.
Markers.TripleTriad.ShowLockedCards.Name: Show locked cards
Markers.TripleTriad.ShowLockedCards.Desc: Shows markers for cards that are locked behind incomplete quests or other requirements.
Markers.Vista.Name: Sightseeing Log Markers
Markers.Vista.Description: Shows world markers for the sightseeing log vistas in the current zone that are not yet completed.
Markers.Waymark.Name: Waymark Markers
Markers.Waymark.Description: Shows world markers for the placed waymarks in the current zone.
Settings.Window.Title: Umbra Settings
Settings.AppearanceModule.Name: Appearance
Settings.AppearanceModule.BuildInMessage: Please create a new theme to start editing.
The default font that is used for most texts.
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Monospac: The monospace font is used for texts that require fixed-width characters, such as the clock.
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.Emphasis: The emphasis font is typically used for decorative texts in some toolbar widgets
Settings.AppearanceModule.Fonts.WorldMar: The font that is used for the text on world markers.
Settings.AppearanceModule.EnableShadow.D: Adds a soft shadow around the toolbar to make it stand out more.
Settings.AppearanceModule.RoundedCorners: Slightly rounds the corners of the toolbar. Enabling this only works if the toolbar is not stretched to the edges of the screen.
Settings.AppearanceModule.EnableInactive: Enables the use of inactive colors for the toolbar. Inactive colors are used when the toolbar is not in focus or when the mouse cursor is not near it.
Settings.AppearanceModule.PopupAppearanc: Adds a soft shadow around the popup menus to make them stand out more. It is recommended to disable this setting if you're using transparent popups.
Forces widget popups to be displayed as floating windows rather than being attached to the toolbar. It is recommended to enable this setting if you're using a transparent toolbar.
Rounds the corners of the popup menus.
Settings.AppearanceModule.CreateColorPro: Create a new color profile based on the currently active profile. Give your new profile a name and hit the confirm button.
An existing profile with the same name will be overwritten.
Settings.AppearanceModule.DeleteColorPro: Are you sure you want to delete the color profile "{0}"? This operation cannot be undone.
You can now paste the color profile of "{0}" into a text file or share it with others.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.In: Invalid color profile format. The text in your clipboard is not a valid color profile for Umbra.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.No: No color profile found in the imported data. The text in your clipboard does not contain a color profile for Umbra.
Settings.AppearanceModule.ImportError.Du: A color profile with the same name already exists. Please delete the old profile and try again.
Settings.MarkersModule.Name: World Markers
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.Enabled.Na: Show markers of this type in the game world
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.ShowOnComp: Show direction indicator when out of view
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.FadeDistan: The distance in yalms between your character and the marker at which it fades out.
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.FadeAttenu: An added range to the configured fade distance from which the marker will start to fade out.
Settings.MarkersModule.Config.MaxVisible: The maximum distance in yalms at which the marker is visible. After this distance, the marker will fade out to prevent clutter of too many visible markers on the screen. Set to 0 to disable.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Enabled.Name: Enable this auxiliary bar
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Name.Name: Auxiliary Bar Name
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Decorate.Name: Decorate the bar
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Decorate.Desc: Decorates the auxiliary bar with a background and border similar to the main toolbar. The auxiliary bar will be transparent if this setting is disabled.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Vertical.Name: Vertical orientation
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Vertical.Desc: Whether to display the auxiliary bar in a vertical orientation and render widgets from top to bottom.
Adds a soft shadow around the auxiliary bar to make it stand out more.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.RoundedCorner: Slightly rounds the corners of the auxiliary bar.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ItemSpacing.D: Defines the distance between widgets in pixels.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.XAlign.Name: Horizontal alignment
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.XAlign.Descri: The horizontal alignment of the auxiliary bar relative to the screen.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.YAlign.Name: Vertical alignment
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.YAlign.Descri: The vertical alignment of the auxiliary bar relative to the screen.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.XPosition.Des: The horizontal position of the auxiliary bar from the screen edge in pixels.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.YPosition.Des: The vertical position of the auxiliary bar from the screen edge in pixels.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Width.Name: Width
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.Width.Descrip: The width of the auxiliary bar. This option is ignored if the auxiliary bar is displayed vertically. Setting the width to 0 will automatically resize the auxiliary bar depending on its content.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.WidgetContent: When using the vertical layout, this option will define the alignment of the auxiliary bar widgets.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HideInCutscen: Hides the auxiliary bar during cutscenes. This option takes precedence over the conditional visibility settings below.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HideInPvP.Des: Hides the auxiliary bar during PvP duties. This option takes precedence over the conditional visibility settings below.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HideInDuty.De: Hides the auxiliary bar during instanced duties. This option takes precedence over the conditional visibility settings below.
Hides the auxiliary bar during combat. This option takes precedence over the conditional visibility settings below.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HideIfUnsheat: Hide when your weapon is unsheathed
Hides the auxiliary bar when your weapon is unsheathed. This option takes precedence over the conditional visibility settings below.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ConditionalVi: Allows you to specify conditions under which the auxiliary bar should be shown.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HoldKey.Name: Hold key to force show
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.HoldKey.Descr: Holding this key will force the auxiliary bar to be shown.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ShowInCutscen: Shows the auxiliary bar during cutscenes.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ShowInGPose.D: Shows the auxiliary bar while group pose is active.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ShowInInstanc: Shows the auxiliary bar in instances, such as dungeons, trials, and raids.
Shows the auxiliary bar during combat.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Aux.ShowUnsheathe: Show when your weapon is unsheathed
Shows the auxiliary bar when your weapon is unsheathed.
Settings.WidgetsModule.DeleteBar: Delete this bar and all its widgets
Settings.WidgetsModule.DeleteBarConfirma: Are you sure you wish to permanently delete the bar "{0}"? This also deletes any and all added widgets associated with this bar. This operation cannot be undone.
If you just wish to temporarily disable this bar, you can do so in its settings.
Settings.WidgetsModule.DragWidgets: Drag widgets around to rearrange them.
Settings.WidgetsModule.Name: Toolbar Widgets
Settings.WidgetsModule.EditWidget: Edit instance settings of this widget
Settings.WidgetsModule.CopyWidget: Create a copy of this widget and its instance settings.
Settings.WidgetsModule.AddFromClipboard: Import a widget from your clipboard.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Name: Config Profiles
Settings.ProfilesModule.Description: A config profile allows you to share the same configuration across multiple characters. Note that all of Umbra's settings are included in your configuration. This includes but is not limited to: Color themes, toolbar profiles and widget settings. This means that installed color themes and toolbar profiles may be available in one config profile, but not in another.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ShareWarning: WARNING: Config profiles are solely meant for personal backups and not meant to be shared.
Settings.ProfilesModule.CreateProfile: Create a new profile based on the current settings.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Activate.Des: Umbra will reload upon activation of this profile. This will cause the settings window to close.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Export.Name: Export this profile
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Export.Descr: Exports this profile to the clipboard. You can then paste it into a text file to keep it as a backup.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Import.Name: Import a profile
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Import.Descr: Imports a profile from the clipboard. This will overwrite the data in this profile.
Settings.ProfilesModule.Btn.Delete.Name: Delete this profile
Settings.ProfilesModule.DeleteProfileCon: Are you sure you want to delete the profile "{0}"? This operation cannot be undone.
Be aware that all installed color themes and toolbar profiles associated with this config profile will also be deleted.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ImportProfileCon: Are you sure you want to import the data on your clipboard to profile "{0}"? This operation cannot be undone.
Be aware that all installed color themes and toolbar profiles associated with this config profile will be overwritten by the imported data.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ImportProfileFai: The profile you tried to import is invalid. Please make sure that the text in your clipboard is a valid Umbra profile.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ImportProfileSuc: The profile was imported successfully. Umbra will now restart to apply the changes.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ExportProfileSuc: The profile "{0}" was exported to the clipboard. You can now paste it into a text file to keep it as a backup for later.
Settings.ProfilesModule.ActivateProfileS: The profile "{0}" was activated successfully. Umbra will now restart to apply the changes.
Settings.PluginsModule.Name: Plugins
Settings.PluginsModule.WarningText: Third-party plugins should only be installed from trusted sources. Similar to third-party Dalamud plugins, Umbra plugins also have complete access to your machine and can do anything they want. Please be careful when installing plugins from untrusted sources. Umbra does not provide any support for third-party plugins, nor can its authors be held responsible for any issues that may arise from their use.
Settings.PluginsModule.WarningAccept: I have read and agreed to the above statement.
Settings.PluginsModule.InstallFromReposi: Install a plugin from a GitHub repository. Enter the author and repository name to install a plugin. If the repository URL would be https://github.com/una-xiv/my-plugin, then the owner would be "una-xiv" and the repository name would be "my-plugin".
The specified repository does not exist, does not contain a plugin or does not contain any published releases. Please make sure that the owner and repository names are spelled correctly.
Please review the information below. Only proceed if you consider this to be a trusted source.
Settings.PluginsModule.InstallFromFile.D: Install a plugin from a DLL file on your computer. Click the browse button to select the file.
Settings.PluginsModule.PluginRestartRequ: Umbra needs to be restarted to load this plugin.
Settings.PluginsModule.Plugin.Author: Author
Settings.AddWidgetWindow.Title: Add Widget
CVAR.Sound.Enabled.Name: Enable sound effects
CVAR.Sound.Enabled.Description: Whether to play sound effects for certain actions, such as opening a widget popup.
CVAR.Sound.OpenPopupId.Name: Open popup sound
CVAR.Sound.OpenPopupId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a widget popup is opened.
CVAR.Sound.ClosePopupId.Name: Close popup sound
CVAR.Sound.ClosePopupId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a widget popup is closed.
CVAR.Sound.OpenWindowId.Name: Open window sound
CVAR.Sound.OpenWindowId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a window is opened.
CVAR.Sound.CloseWindowId.Name: Close window sound
CVAR.Sound.CloseWindowId.Description: The sound effect that is played when a window is closed.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Enabled.Name: Enable Compass
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Enabled.Description: Whether to show the compass that indicates the direction of markers that are currently out of view.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Radius.Name: Compass Radius
CVAR.Markers.Compass.Radius.Description: The radius of the compass in pixels. The compass is an imaginary circular element around your character that shows the direction of markers that are currently out of view.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconScaleFactor.Des: The scale factor of the icons on the compass. This value is a percentage of the default size.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconOpacity.Name: Compass Icon Opacity
CVAR.Markers.Compass.IconOpacity.Descrip: The opacity of the icons on the compass. 100 is fully opaque, 0 is fully transparent.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.SafeZoneOffsetWidth: The distance in pixels from the left and right edges of the screen that a world marker must be within to be considered in the safe zone. Direction indicators are rendered for world markers that are outside of the safe zone.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.SafeZoneOffsetHeigh: The distance in pixels from the top and bottom edges of the screen that a world marker must be within to be considered in the safe zone. Direction indicators are rendered for world markers that are outside of the safe zone.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.YOffset.Name: Center point vertical offset
CVAR.Markers.Compass.YOffset.Description: The vertical offset of the center point of the compass from the center of the screen in pixels.
CVAR.Markers.Compass.XOffset.Name: Center point horizontal offset
CVAR.Markers.Compass.XOffset.Description: The horizontal offset of the center point of the compass from the center of the screen in pixels.
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.Enabled.Name: Enable 3D Markers
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.Enabled.Descriptio: Whether to show markers in the game world.
The distance in yalms at which markers are grouped together into a single marker. This can help reduce clutter when there are many markers in the same area.
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.MaxWidth.Name: Max text width
CVAR.Markers.Renderer.MaxWidth.Descripti: The maximum width of a marker in pixels. Increase this value to show more text on markers if it gets cut off too often.
CVAR.General.UiScale.Name: UI Scale
CVAR.General.UiScale.Description: The interface scale factor for all Umbra elements. This value is a percentage of the default size. Hit enter to apply the given value. Note that input elements are not affected by this setting. Use the global font scaling setting in Dalamud settings for those instead.
CVAR.General.UseGameMouseCursor.Name: Use the game's mouse cursor
CVAR.General.UseGameMouseCursor.Descript: Whether to use the game's mouse cursor instead of the OS default cursor. Note that this is a global setting that affects other Dalamud plugins as well. If another plugin already changes this setting, changing it here may have no effect.
CVAR.General.ShowInputControlDescription: Whether to show the descriptions of input fields. Disabling this feature adds tooltips to input field names instead.
CVAR.General.EnableHitchWarnings.Name: Enable Umbra-specific hitch warnings in the console
CVAR.General.EnableHitchWarnings.Descrip: [DEBUG TOOL] Whether to log warnings to the console when Umbra causes slight game hitches. This can help you identify performance issues.
CVAR.General.TickHitchThresholdMs.Name: Tick hitch threshold in milliseconds
CVAR.General.DrawHitchThresholdMs.Name: Draw hitch threshold in milliseconds
CVAR.General.LanguageOverride.Name: Language Override (Reloads the plugin)
CVAR.General.LanguageOverride.Descriptio: Overrides Dalamud's language setting for Umbra. Note that this only affects Umbra-specific translations. Texts that come from the game itself will still be shown in the game's language. Modifying this value will reload the plugin, causing the settings window to close.
CVAR.General.DecimalSeparator.Name: Decimal separator
CVAR.General.DecimalSeparator.Descriptio: The character used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number. This setting affects how numbers are displayed in Umbra.
CVAR.General.ThousandsSeparator.Name: Thousands separator
CVAR.General.ThousandsSeparator.Descript: The character used to separate groups of three digits in a number. This setting affects how numbers are displayed in Umbra.
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInCutscenes.Name: Show the toolbar while playing cutscenes
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInGPose.Name: Show the toolbar while GPose is active
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarOnUserHide.Name: Show the toolbar when the UI is manually hidden
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarBetweenAreas.Nam: Show the toolbar during loading screens
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarDuringIdleCam.Na: Show the toolbar during idle camera (AFK) mode
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInDuty.Name: Show the toolbar in duties
CVAR.General.ShowToolbarInCombat.Name: Show the toolbar during combat
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInCutscenes.Name: Show world markers while playing cutscenes
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInGPose.Name: Show world markers while GPose is active
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersOnUserHide.Name: Show world markers when the UI is manually hidden
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersBetweenAreas.Nam: Show world markers during loading screens
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersDuringIdleCam.Na: Show world markers during idle camera (AFK) mode
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInDuty.Name: Show world markers in duties
CVAR.General.ShowMarkersInCombat.Name: Show world markers during combat
CVAR.DelvUI.ClipRects.Enabled.Name: Enable DelvUI window clipping
CVAR.DelvUI.ClipRects.Enabled.Descriptio: Let Umbra synchronize positions of windows and widget popups with DelvUI's window clipping system to prevent DelvUI from intercepting mouse events while Umbra's elements are rendered on top of them.
CVAR.Toolbar.Enabled.Name: Enable the toolbar
CVAR.Toolbar.Enabled.Description: Whether to display the toolbar. Use the "/umbra" command to open the settings window if you decide to disable the toolbar.
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupAlignmentMethod.Name: Widget popup alignment method
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupAlignmentMethod.Descri: The method used to align popup menus to their widgets. The 'Centered' option will always try to center a popup menu based on the widget location, while the 'aligned' method always aligns the popup to the left or right side of the widget, depending on the location of the widget on the toolbar. The latter option also helps stabilizing widget positions when the widget popup is dynamically resized.
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupActivationMethod.Name: Widget popup activation method
CVAR.Toolbar.PopupActivationMethod.Descr: The method used to activate popup menus from widgets. "ClickAndHover" requires a click to open the popup and allows hovering over other widgets to open their popups for as long as one popup is open. The "Click" option only open popups by clicking on widgets while the "Hover" option opens popups immediately when hovering over widgets.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsTopAligned.Name: Place the toolbar at the top of the screen.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsTopAligned.Description: Aligns the toolbar to the top of the screen rather than the bottom.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsStretched.Name: Stretch the toolbar to the screen edges
CVAR.Toolbar.IsStretched.Description: Stretches the toolbar to the left and right edges of the screen.
CVAR.Toolbar.IsAutoHideEnabled.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar
CVAR.Toolbar.IsAutoHideEnabled.Descripti: Hides the toolbar when the mouse cursor is not near it. The toolbar will reappear when the mouse cursor is near the toolbar.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringCutscenes.Nam: Automatically hide the toolbar during cutscenes
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringCutscenes.Des: Forces the auto-hide behavior during cutscenes, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during cutscenes unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringDuty.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar during duties
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringDuty.Descript: Forces the auto-hide behavior during duties, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during duties unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringPvp.Name: Automatically hide the toolbar during PVP
CVAR.Toolbar.AutoHideDuringPvp.Descripti: Forces the auto-hide behavior during pvp, allowing the toolbar to be hidden during pvp unless the mouse cursor is near it.
CVAR.Toolbar.EnableQuickSettingAccess.De: Allows you to quickly access settings of widgets by holding CONTROL + SHIFT and right-clicking on them from the toolbar. Note that enabling this setting will cause some widgets to appear interactable when hovering over them, while they are not.
CVAR.Toolbar.Height.Name: Toolbar height
CVAR.Toolbar.Height.Description: The height of the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.ItemSpacing.Name: Toolbar widget spacing
CVAR.Toolbar.ItemSpacing.Description: Defines the distance between toolbar widgets in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginLeft.Name: Toolbar left margin
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginLeft.Description: The distance between the left edge of the screen and the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginRight.Name: Toolbar right margin
CVAR.Toolbar.MarginRight.Description: The distance between the right edge of the screen and the toolbar in pixels.
CVAR.Toolbar.YOffset.Name: Toolbar vertical offset
CVAR.Toolbar.YOffset.Description: The vertical offset of the toolbar from the top or bottom of the screen in pixels.
Widget.Deprecated: This widget is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of Umbra.
Widget.Deprecated.Alt: This widget is deprecated and will be removed in a future version of Umbra. Please use the "{0}" widget instead.
Widget.Defaults.Enabled.Name: Enable the widget
Widget.Defaults.Enabled.Description: Whether this widget should be enabled and visible on the toolbar.
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.DesaturateMenuI: Desaturates the icons in the menu to make it appear in grayscale.
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.VerticalItemSpa: The vertical distance between menu items in pixels.
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.MenuHeight.Name: Menu height
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.MenuHeight.Desc: The height of the menu in pixels.
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.ReverseCategori: Reverses the order of the categories and pinned items in the menu.
Widgets.MenuPopup.Config.ItemFontSize.De: The text size of the items in the popup menu.
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconType.Name: Icon type
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconType.Descrip: The type of icon to use for the widget.
Widgets.Standard.Config.GameIconId.Name: Game Icon
Widgets.Standard.Config.GameIconId.Descr: An icon that comes directly from the game.
Widgets.Standard.Config.FaIcon.Name: Font Awesome Icon
Widgets.Standard.Config.FaIcon.Descripti: An icon that comes from Font Awesome. This icon is not a game icon, but a custom icon that is rendered using the Font Awesome font.
Widgets.Standard.Config.GameGlyph.Name: Game Glyph Icon
Widgets.Standard.Config.GameGlyph.Descri: An icon that comes from the game that is usually occurs within text.
Widgets.Standard.Config.BitmapIcon.Name: Bitmap Font Icon
Widgets.Standard.Config.BitmapIcon.Descr: An icon that comes from the game's bitmap font. These icons are typically used in chat messages.
Widgets.Standard.Config.Decorate.Name: Decorate the widget
Widgets.Standard.Config.Decorate.Descrip: Decorates the widget with a background and border.
Widgets.Standard.Config.DesaturateIcon.D: Desaturates the icon of the widget to make it appear in grayscale. Note that it might be harder to see if the button is disabled when this option is enabled.
Widgets.Standard.Config.DisplayMode.Name: Widget display mode
Widgets.Standard.Config.DisplayMode.Desc: The way the widget should be displayed.
Widgets.Standard.Config.SizingMode.Name: Sizing Mode
Widgets.Standard.Config.SizingMode.Descr: The way the width of the widget should be calculated
Widgets.Standard.Config.Width.Name: Widget Width
Widgets.Standard.Config.Width.Descriptio: The width of the widget in pixel.
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconLocation.Des: The location of the icon relative to the text.
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconSize.Name: Custom icon size
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconSize.Descrip: A custom size for the button icon in pixels. Set to 0 to use the default size.
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconColor.Name: Custom icon color
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconColor.Descri: A custom color mask to apply to the icon image.
Widgets.Standard.Config.ShowSubText.Name: Show subtext
Widgets.Standard.Config.ShowSubText.Desc: Whether to show the subtext of the widget. The subtext is a smaller text that is displayed below the main text.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextAlign.Name: Text alignment
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextAlign.Descri: The alignment of the widget text.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextYOffset.Desc: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing a single label.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextYOffsetTop.D: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing two labels.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextYOffsetBotto: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing two labels.
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconYOffset.Name: Icon vertical offset
Widgets.Standard.Config.IconYOffset.Desc: The vertical offset of the icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widgets.Standard.Config.MinTextWidth.Des: The minimum width of the text in pixels. If the text is wider than this value, it will be truncated and an ellipsis will be added. Set to 0 to disable fixed width and let the widget automatically adjust its width based on its content.
Widgets.Standard.Config.MaxTextWidth.Des: The maximum width of text in pixels. Giving a value greater than 0 allows labels to grow up to the specified width. Any text that does not fit will be truncated and an ellipsis will be added.
Widgets.Standard.Config.HorizontalPaddin: The padding between the outer edges of the widget and the text or icons in pixels, allowing you to increase the size of the clickable area.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextSize.Name: Text size (without subtext)
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextSize.Descrip: The size of the text in pixels. Set to 13 to use the default size.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextSizeTop.Name: Text size (with subtext)
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextSizeTop.Desc: The size of the top text in pixels. Set to 11 to use the default size.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextSizeBottom.D: The size of the sub text in pixels. Set to 9 to use the default size.
Widgets.Standard.Config.UseCustomTextCol: Whether to use a custom text color for the widget. If this option is disabled, the text color will be determined by the theme.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextColor.Name: Custom text color
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextColor.Descri: The custom text color to use for the widget. This color will be used instead of the theme color.
Widgets.Standard.Config.TextOutlineColor: The custom text outline color to use for the widget. This color will be used instead of the theme color.
Widgets.Standard.Config.SubTextColor.Des: The custom subtext color to use for the widget. This color will be used instead of the theme color.
Widgets.Standard.Config.SubTextOutlineCo: The custom subtext outline color to use for the widget. This color will be used instead of the theme color.
Whether to show the progress bar element inside the widget.
Widgets.Standard.Config.ProgressBarFillD: The direction in which the progress bar should be filled.
Widgets.Standard.Config.UseCustomProgres: Customize the colors of the progress bar
Whether to use a custom progress bar color for the widget. If this option is disabled, the progress bar color will be determined by the theme.
Widgets.Standard.Config.CustomProgressBa: The color to use for the default progress bar that represent values ranging from 0 to 100%.
The color to use for the progress bar that represent values greater than 100%.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Deco: Decorates the widget with a background and border.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Text: The vertical offset of the text from the center in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up. This setting is only applicable if the widget is showing a single label.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.MaxT: The maximum width of text in pixels. Giving a value greater than 0 allows labels to grow up to the specified width. Any text that does not fit will be truncated and an ellipsis will be added.
Widgets.DefaultToolbarWidget.Config.Text: The size of the text in pixels. Set to 13 to use the default size.
Widget.Accessibility.Name: Accessibility
Widget.Accessibility.Description: Provides you with quick access to accessibility features.
Widget.Alarm.Name: Alarms
Widget.Alarm.Description: Provides quick access to custom defined alarms.
Widget.BattleEffects.Name: Battle Effects Configurator
Widget.BattleEffects.Description: Provides you with options to quickly change the intensity of battle effects, as well as pet sizes of summoners.
Widget.Clock.Name: Clock
Widget.Clock.Description: Displays the current local, server or Eorzea time with lots of customization options.
Widget.Clock.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widget.Clock.Config.TextYOffset.Descript: The vertical offset of the clock text from the center of the clock in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixYOffset.Name: Prefix vertical offset
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixYOffset.Descri: The vertical offset of the prefix text/symbol from the center of the clock in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.Clock.Config.ShowSeconds.Name: Show seconds
Widget.Clock.Config.ShowSeconds.Descript: Whether to show the seconds part of the clock.
Widget.Clock.Config.ClickToSwitch.Name: Enable click to switch time source
Widget.Clock.Config.ClickToSwitch.Descri: Allows you to switch between local, server and Eorzea time by clicking on the clock. A tooltip will show the current time source when hovering over the clock while this option is enabled.
Widget.Clock.Config.Use24HourFormat.Name: Use 24-hour format
Widget.Clock.Config.Use24HourFormat.Desc: Whether to use a 24-hour format for the clock. If disabled, the clock will use a 12-hour format with AM/PM indicators.
Widget.Clock.Config.UseCustomPrefix.Name: Use custom prefix text
Widget.Clock.Config.UseCustomPrefix.Desc: Whether to use a custom text before the clock time. Uses the default game glyphs based on the time source if disabled.
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixText.Name: Prefix text
Widget.Clock.Config.PrefixText.Descripti: Text that is displayed before the clock time. This can be used to add a label to the clock, for example: 'LT', 'ST' or 'ET'.
Widget.Clock.Config.TimeSource.Name: Time source
Widget.Clock.Config.TimeSource.Descripti: The source of the time that is displayed on the clock.
Widget.Clock.Config.AmLabel.Name: AM label
Widget.Clock.Config.AmLabel.Description: The text that is displayed for the AM part of the clock when using a 12-hour format.
Widget.Clock.Config.PmLabel.Name: PM label
Widget.Clock.Config.PmLabel.Description: The text that is displayed for the PM part of the clock when using a 12-hour format.
Widget.Clock.Config.CustomWidth.Name: Custom time display width
Widget.Clock.Config.CustomWidth.Descript: The width of the clock text in pixels. If set to 0, the width will be calculated automatically based on the text content. You may want to choose a fixed width when you use a custom monospace font that does not have fixed-width characters to prevent the widget from resizing when the time changes.
Widget.CollectionItemButton.Name: Collection Item Button
Widget.CollectionItemButton.Description: Provides you with quick access an item of your choosing from your collections list.
The item from the collections list that is displayed on the widget and used when clicked.
Widget.Compass.Name: Compass
Widget.Compass.Description: Shows the direction your character is facing in the game world.
Widget.Compass.Config.UseCameraAngle.Des: When checked, uses the camera angle instead of the direction your character is facing to determine the center point of the compass.
Widget.Compass.Config.Width.Name: Widget width
Widget.Compass.Config.Width.Description: The width of the compass widget in pixels.
Widget.Compass.Config.FishEyePower.Name: Fish-eye power
Widget.Compass.Config.FishEyePower.Descr: The power of the fish-eye effect. A value of 1 disables the effect, while a value lower than 1 increases the effect near the edges. A value higher than 1 increases the effect near the center.
The angle range of the compass in degrees. A value of 360 shows the full compass, while a value of 180 shows only half of it.
Widget.Compass.Config.CenterLineColor.De: The color of the center line of the compass.
Widget.Compass.Config.LineColor.Name: Line color
Widget.Compass.Config.LineColor.Descript: The color of the tick lines in the compass.
Widget.Compass.Config.TextColor.Name: Cardinal indicator color
Widget.Compass.Config.TextColor.Descript: The color of the cardinal letters in the compass.
Widget.Coordinates.Name: Coordinates
Widget.Coordinates.Description: Shows your current coordinates in the game world.
Widget.Durability.Name: Durability & Spiritbond
Widget.Durability.Description: Shows the current durability state and spiritbond progress of your equipped gear with quick access to the Repair & Extract Materia actions.
Widget.Durability.Config.WarningThreshol: The durability percentage at which the widget will change its icon to a warning symbol.
Widget.Durability.Config.CriticalThresho: The durability percentage at which the widget will change its icon to a critical symbol.
Widget.Durability.Config.DisplayMode.Des: The way the durability and spiritbond information is displayed on the widget itself.
Widget.Durability.Config.DisplayMode.Opt: Show both durability and spiritbond percentages with labels.
Show both durability and spiritbond percentages without labels on a single line (durability% / spiritbond%)
Show both durability and spiritbond percentages without labels on two lines (durability% / spiritbond%)
Show only the durability percentage without a label.
Show only the spiritbond percentage without a label.
Widget.Durability.Config.UseBarBorder.De: Show a border around bars making it easier to notice the maximum value.
Widget.Durability.Config.BarWidth.Name: Bar width
Widget.Durability.Config.BarDirection.De: Direction in which the bars will fill.
Widget.Durability.Config.HideWhenOkay.Na: Hide the widget when no action is needed
Widget.Durability.Config.HideWhenOkay.De: Automatically hides the widget when all equipped gear is above the warning threshold and there is nothing to extract materia from.
Widget.Durability.Config.Calculation.Dur: Choose the display mode of the durability value.
Widget.Durability.Config.Calculation.Spi: Choose the display mode of the spiritbond value. Please note that values at 0 will be excluded from calculations.
Widget.DutyRecorderIndicator.Name: Duty Recorder Indicator
Widget.DutyRecorderIndicator.Description: Shows a little recording icon whenever the duty recorder is active.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Name: Experience Bar
Widget.ExperienceBar.Description: Shows your current experience points percentage and visualizes the progress towards the next level.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowExperien: Whether to show the current experience points percentage on the experience bar.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowLevel.De: Whether to show the current level on the experience bar.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowSanctuar: Whether to show the sanctuary icon on the experience bar when you are in a sanctuary.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowLevelSyn: Whether to show the level sync icon on the experience bar when you are level synced.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShowPreciseE: Whether to show the precise amount of experience points on the experience bar. This requires a wide widget to display all the information, unless the shorten-option below is enabled.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.ShortenPreci: Whether to shorten the precise amount of experience points on the experience bar to abbreviated form.
The width of the experience bar in pixels.
Widget.ExperienceBar.Config.DisplayAtMax: Whether to show the experience bar when the current job is at the maximum level.
The vertical offset of the sanctuary icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
The vertical offset of the level sync icon from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the icon down, negative values move the icon up.
Widget.InventorySpace.Name: Inventory Space Indicator
Widget.InventorySpace.Description: Shows the current amount of free space in your inventory.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.Source.Name: Inventory source
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.Source.Desc: The inventory that is used to calculate the free space.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.ShowTotal.D: Whether to show the total amount of inventory space in addition to the free space.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.ShowRemaini: Whether to show the remaining amount of inventory slots instead of used slots.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.WarningThre: The amount of free inventory space at which the widget will change its icon to a warning symbol.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.CriticalThr: The amount of free inventory space at which the widget will change its icon to a critical symbol.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.InventoryIc: The icon that is displayed when the source is set to Inventory.
Widget.InventorySpace.Config.SaddlebagIc: The icon that is displayed when the source is set to Chocobo Saddlebag.
Widget.Location.Name: Location
Widget.Location.Description: Displays the current map and area name.
Widget.Location.Config.ShowCoordinates.D: Whether to show the current player coordinates. Enabling this will replace the district name with the player coordinates.
Widget.DtrBar.Name: Server Info Bar
Widget.DtrBar.Description: Displays a group of widgets that originate from the In-game server info bar.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.DecorateMode.Name: Decorate mode
Widget.DtrBar.Config.DecorateMode.Descri: Determines when server info bar entries should be decorated with a background and border.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.PlainText.Name: Show items as plain text
Widget.DtrBar.Config.PlainText.Descripti: Shows the items as plain text without any decoration such as custom colors and icons. Enabling this option will increase performance.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.TextYOffset.Name: Text vertical offset
Widget.DtrBar.Config.TextYOffset.Descrip: The vertical offset of the text from the center of the widget in pixels. Positive values move the text down, negative values move the text up.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.HideNative.Name: Auto-hide the native server info bar
Widget.DtrBar.Config.HideNative.Descript: Hides the native server info bar when the server info bar widget is visible. The native server info bar will be shown again when the widget is no longer visible.
Widget.DtrBar.Config.ItemSpacing.Name: Item spacing
Widget.DtrBar.Config.ItemSpacing.Descrip: The distance between server info bar items in pixels.
Widget.DtrSingle.Name: Single Server Info Bar Entry
Widget.DtrSingle.Description: Shows a button for a single server info bar entry of a selected plugin.
Widget.DtrSingle.Config.SelectedEntry.De: The server info bar entry that should be displayed in the widget.
Widget.PluginList.Name: Plugin List
Widget.PluginList.Description: Quick access to your installed Dalamud plugins that provide a main command and/or settings.
Widget.PluginList.Tooltip: Right-click to open Dalamud's Plugin Installer window. Hold control or shift while clicking a plugin in the menu to open its configuration window if it also has a main window.
Widget.PluginList.Config.ShowTooltip.Des: Whether to show a tooltip with control hints when hovering over the plugin list widget.
Widget.PluginList.Config.EnabledCategory: Visible plugins (Restart Umbra to refresh this list)
Widget.RetainerList.Name: Retainers
Widget.RetainerList.Description: Shows a list of your retainers with quick access to an overview that displays their venture status, amount of items on sale and how much gil is kept. Note that not all information may be up-to-date until you visit a summoning bell.
Widget.RetainerList.Popup.Name: Name
Widget.RetainerList.Config.IconType.Name: Job icon type
Widget.RetainerList.Config.IconType.Desc: The type of icon that is used to represent the job of the retainer.
Widget.RetainerList.Config.ShowGil.Name: Show gil column
Widget.RetainerList.Config.ShowGil.Descr: Whether to show the amount of gil that is kept by the retainer.
Widget.RetainerList.Config.ShowInventory: Whether to show the amount of items that are stored in the retainer's inventory.
Widget.RetainerList.Config.ShowItemsOnSa: Whether to show the amount of items that are currently on sale.
Widget.RetainerList.Config.ShowVenture.D: Whether to show the current venture status of the retainer.
Widget.Separator.Name: Separator
Widget.Separator.Description: A simple line separator that can be used to separate other widgets.
Widget.Separator.Config.Width.Name: Additional width
Widget.Separator.Config.Width.Descriptio: The extra width of the distance between widgets in pixels. Widget spacing in Toolbar customization settings is always taken into account, regardless of this setting.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineWidth.Name: Line width
Widget.Separator.Config.LineWidth.Descri: The width of the line in pixels.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineHeight.Name: Line height
Widget.Separator.Config.LineHeight.Descr: The height of the line in pixels.
Widget.Separator.Config.LineColor.Name: Line color
Widget.Spacer.Name: Spacer
Widget.Spacer.Description: A simple spacer with a configurable width that can be used to separate other widgets.
Widget.Spacer.Config.Width.Name: Additional width
Widget.Spacer.Config.Width.Description: The extra width of the distance between widgets in pixels. Widget spacing in Toolbar customization settings is always taken into account, regardless of this setting.
Widget.StackedClock.Name: Stacked Clock
Widget.StackedClock.Description: Shows the current local, server or Eorzea time with lots of customization options in a stacked layout.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.EnablePopup.D: Whether to show a popup with additional time information when the widget is clicked.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.TimeSourceTop: The source of the time that is displayed on the top clock.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.TimeSourceBot: The source of the time that is displayed on the bottom clock.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.TimeFormatTop: The format of the time that is displayed on the top clock. "HH:mm" is the default format for 24-hour clocks, "h:mm tt" is the default format for 12-hour clocks.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.TimeFormatBot: The format of the time that is displayed on the bottom clock. "HH:mm" is the default format for 24-hour clocks, "h:mm tt" is the default format for 12-hour clocks.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.TimeFormatPop: The format of the time that is displayed in the popup when the widget is clicked. "HH:mm:ss" is the default format for 24-hour clocks, "h:mm:ss tt" is the default format for 12-hour clocks.
Widget.StackedClock.Config.PrefixPositio: The position of the prefix icon relative to the time.
Widget.MailIndicator.Name: Unread Mail Indicator
Widget.MailIndicator.Description: Shows a small mail icon when you have unread mail.
Widget.MailIndicator.Config.AlwaysShow.D: Always show the mail indicator, even when there is no mail. The widget will show itself in a disabled state when there is no unread mail.
Widget.MailIndicator.Tooltip.Singular: You have an unread message. Visit a Delivery Moogle to read it.
Widget.MailIndicator.Tooltip.Plural: You have {0} unread messages. Visit a Delivery Moogle to read them.
Widget.Weather.Name: Weather Forecast
Widget.Weather.Description: Shows the current weather and the upcoming weather forecast for the next couple of hours.
Widget.Weather.Config.TimeFormat.Name: Time format
Widget.Weather.Config.TimeFormat.Descrip: Specifies how time is presented for each forecast entry in both the widget and the popup.
Widget.Weather.Config.MaxForecastEntries: The maximum number of weather forecast entries to show in the popup when the widget is clicked. A value of 0 will prevent the popup from opening.
Widget.Weather.Config.Spacing.Name: Spacing between weather icon and text
Widget.Weather.Config.Spacing.Descriptio: The distance between the weather icon and the text. This setting only applies to the toolbar widget itself.
Widget.WorldName.Name: World Name
Widget.WorldName.Description: Shows the name of the current world. Has an option to hide itself when you are on your home world.
Hides the widget when you are on your home world. This can be useful to preserve space in the toolbar.
Widget.MainMenu.Name: Main Menu Button
Widget.MainMenu.Description: Shows a button that opens the configured main menu.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.Category.Name: Menu category
Widget.MainMenu.Config.Category.Descript: The category of the main menu that should be opened when the button is clicked.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.ShowItemIcons.Nam: Show item icons in the menu
Widget.MainMenu.Config.ShowItemIcons.Des: Whether to show icons in the popup menu for items that have icons associated with them.
Widget.MainMenu.Config.UseCustomIcon.Des: Whether to use a custom icon for the button instead of the default one. Enabling this allows you to pick a custom icon in the Icon-tab.
Widget.Currencies.Name: Currencies
Widget.Currencies.Description: Shows the current amount of gil and company credits.
Widget.Currencies.Config.TrackedCurrency: The currency that should be tracked and displayed in the widget on the toolbar.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowName.Name: Show tracked currency name
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowName.Descri: Whether to show the name of the tracked currency next to the value.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowCap.Name: Show currency cap (if available)
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowCap.Descrip: Whether to show the currency cap of the tracked currency next to the value.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ShowCapOnWidget: Show currency cap on the toolbar widget
Whether to show the currency cap of the tracked currency on the widget itself.
Widget.Currencies.Config.CustomWidgetLab: A custom label that should be displayed when no currency is being tracked. Leave empty to use the default label.
Widget.Currencies.Config.CustomCurrencyI: A comma-separated list of custom currency/item IDs to show in the popup. This can be used to track currencies that are not part of the default list. Use SimpleTweak's "Show ID" tooltip feature to find out the ID of an item or currency.
Widget.Currencies.Config.EnableMouseInte: Shows a popup menu with all currencies when clicking on the widget.
Widget.Currencies.Config.UseThresholdCol: Whether to use different colors for the currency value based on the amount of currency you have. This can be useful to quickly see if you are close to capping out a currency.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ThresholdPercen: The percentage of the currency cap at which the color will change to a warning color.
The color that is used when the currency amount is above the threshold percentage.
Widget.Currencies.Config.ThresholdCapCol: The color that is used when the currency amount is capped.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Name: Dynamic Menu
Widget.DynamicMenu.Description: Shows a dynamic menu with customizable items that can be added, removed and reordered.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.ButtonLabel.De: The label that is displayed on the button that opens the dynamic menu.
The tooltip that is displayed when hovering over the button that opens the dynamic menu.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.EditModeEnable: Enables a placeholder item at the bottom of the menu which opens a context menu to add new items to the menu.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.MenuEntryHeigh: The height of each menu entry in pixels.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.MenuFontSize.D: The font size of the menu entries.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.MenuAltFontSiz: The font size of the sub-labels of menu entries. These labels are displayed on the right side of the entry and can be configured for "Custom Entry"-items.
Widget.DynamicMenu.Config.ShowSubIcons.D: Whether to show a contextual icon on top of the main icon. For example, crafting recipes show a book icon on top of the main icon to denote that they are recipes.
Whether to show the amount of items in your inventory as a number on top of the icon. You might want to disable this if the configured entry height is too small.
Widget.DynamicMenu.EmptyButtonPlaceholde: Right-click here to add a new item
Widget.DynamicMenu.MacroItemEditor.Title: Edit Macro Item
Widget.DynamicMenu.CustomItemEditor.Labe: The name of the custom item that is displayed in the dynamic menu.
Widget.DynamicMenu.CustomItemEditor.AltL: A sub-label that is displayed on the right side on the menu item.
Widget.DynamicMenu.CustomItemEditor.Icon: The icon that is displayed next to the custom item in the dynamic menu.
A custom color mask to apply to the icon of this menu item. Use solid white (#FFFFFF) to effectively disable the color mask and use the icon's original colors.
Widget.DynamicMenu.CustomItemEditor.Type: The type of invocation that is used when the custom item is clicked.
Widget.DynamicMenu.CustomItemEditor.Comm: The chat command or URL that is executed when the custom item is clicked. How this is handled depends on the selected invocation type.
Widget.DynamicMenu.SeparatorEditor.Title: Edit Separator
Widget.DynamicMenu.SeparatorEditor.Label: Separator label
The label that is displayed on the separator in the dynamic menu. If you leave this empty, the separator will be displayed as a single line without a label.
Widget.DynamicMenu.CategoryEditor.Title: Edit Category
The label that is displayed on the category in the dynamic menu. If you leave this empty, the category will be displayed as a single line without a label.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Name: Emote Chat Indicator
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Description: Shows an indicator when emotes are being written to the chat, with an option to turn it off.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Tooltip.Enable: Emotes are being written to the chat. Click to disable.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Tooltip.Disabl: Emotes are not being written to the chat. Click to enable.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Config.OnlySho: Only shows the emote chat indicator when writing emotes to the chat is enabled.
Widget.EmoteChatIndicator.Config.OffIcon: The icon that is displayed when writing emotes to the chat is disabled.
The icon that is displayed when writing emotes to the chat is enabled.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Name: Toolbar Pin
Widget.ToolbarPin.Description: A simple button that allows you to toggle the toolbar's auto-hide feature.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.LockIcon.Name: Pinned icon
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.LockIcon.Descri: The icon that is displayed on the toolbar pin button when the toolbar is pinned.
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.UnlockIcon.Name: Unpinned icon
Widget.ToolbarPin.Config.UnlockIcon.Desc: The icon that is displayed on the toolbar pin button when the toolbar is unpinned.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Name: Gearset Switcher
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Description: Shows your currently equipped gearset and some statistics about it. The popup of this widget provides you with an organized overview of all your gearsets, categorized by role.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.RandomJobDisabled: Switch to a DoM/DoW job of which you have at least another job of the same level.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.CustomLabe: If not empty, the text entered will be used as label instead of the gearset name.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.InfoType.D: The type of information that should be displayed as a sub-label on the widget while the job is not max level.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.InfoTypeMa: The type of information that should be displayed as a sub-label on the widget while the job is at the level cap.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowSynced: Show synced level (if info type is job level or auto)
Whether to show the synced level in the info sub-label when the job level is synced down compared to your actual level.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.WidgetButt: The type of icon that should be displayed on the toolbar widget button.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.EnableRole: Limit role container heights and enable scrolling

Limits the height of the role containers in the popup and enables scrolling when there are too many gearsets to display. You can customize the maximum amount of visible gearsets per role in the options below.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowHeader: Whether to show a header at the top of the popup with the name of the currently equipped gearset and various buttons to quickly access certain features.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.PopupHeade: The type of icon that should be displayed in the popup header.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.PopupButto: The type of icon that should be displayed on the gearset buttons in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowRole.D: Whether to show the gearsets associated with this role in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowRoleTi: Whether to show the title of this role in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleLocati: The location of the gearsets associated with this role in the popup.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleSortIn: The order in which the roles are displayed in the popup within the configured column. Lower values are displayed first.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.RoleMaxIte: The maximum number of gearsets to show for this role before the list starts to scroll.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowGradie: Whether to show a gradient background using the current role color.
Show gradient background on gearset buttons
Whether to show a gradient background on individual gearset buttons using its associated role color.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ButtonGrad: The type of gradient that should be used on gearset buttons.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ButtonWidt: The width of the gearset buttons in pixels.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ButtonHeig: The height of the gearset buttons in pixels.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.FilterLogi: Specify if gearsets should be either hidden or shown when they match the configured prefix.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.GearsetFil: Filters gearsets with this prefix in the popup. This can be useful to minimize the amount of gearsets that are displayed in the popup. Specify multiple prefixes by separating them with a comma (e.g. "[PVP], [RP]"). The filter ignores leading/trailing whitespace.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.HidePrefix: Hide the configured prefix from gearset names
Hides the configured prefix from gearset names to reduce visual clutter.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.Progressba: Use role colors for progress bars
Whether to use the role color of the currently equipped job for the experience progress bar.
Widget.GearsetSwitcher.Config.ShowCrafte: Whether to highlight crafter jobs with specialist crystal.
Widget.OnlineStatus.Name: Online Status
Widget.OnlineStatus.Description: Shows your current online status and gives you the option to change it.
Widget.OnlineStatus.Tooltip: Right-click to open the search info window.
Widget.MarkerControl.Name: World Marker Control
Widget.MarkerControl.Description: Allows you to quickly toggle world marker types on and off from a popup menu.
Widget.Societies.Name: Societal Relations
Widget.Societies.Description: Shows the current status of your Societal Relations (Previously known as Beast Tribes).
Widget.Societies.Config.ButtonLabel.Name: Button label (if not tracking)
Widget.Societies.Config.ButtonLabel.Desc: The label that should be displayed on the widget button when no Societal Relations are being tracked.
Widget.Societies.Config.MinItemsBeforeHo: Minimum amount of unlocked societies before switching to horizontal view

Window.IconPicker.Title: Icon Picker
Window.ScriptHelp.Title: Script Help
Window.ScriptHelp.Tab.Examples.Placehold: Placeholders are used to insert dynamic values into your labels. They are special names that are enclosed in square brackets. For example, the placeholder [player.name] will be replaced with your character's name when the script is executed. You can use placeholders to display information such as your character's name, job, level, and more.
Window.ScriptHelp.Tab.Examples.Functions: Sometimes you want to modify the value of a placeholder before it is displayed. For example, you might want to display your character's name in uppercase letters. You can do this by using functions. Functions are special commands that are written immediately after a placeholder, separated by a pipe (|) character. For example, to display your character's name in uppercase, you simply write [player.name|upper].
Window.ScriptHelp.Tab.Examples.Condition:
Conditionals are used to display different values based on certain conditions. For example, you might want to display your character's job only if you are mounted. You can do this by using ternary statements. A ternary statement is a special syntax that allows you to write an if-else statement in a single line. The syntax is as follows: [condition ? value_if_true : value_if_false]. For example, to display your character's job only if you are mounted, you can write [player.is_mounted ? "I am mounted!" : "I am walking."].

Some placeholders return numeric values, for example [player.level]. If you want to display something only if your level is 10 or above, you can write a comparison statement like this: [player.level > 9 ? "You are level 10 or above!" : "You are below level 10."]. You can do similar comparisons with the equals operator (=) or the less than operator (<).
Window.ScriptHelp.Tab.Examples.Concatena: You can combine multiple placeholders and static text into a single string. For example, to display your character's name and job in a single label, you can write [player.name] is a [player.job.name]. This will display something like "John is a Warrior". If you want to combine things between square brackets, you must put your text between double quotes and use a plus-sign (+) to combine them. For example, to display your character's name and level in a single label, you can write ["My name is " + player.name + " and I am level " + player.level]. This will display something like "My name is John and I am level 30".

Window.Installer.Title: Umbra Installer
Window.Installer.Welcome.Title: Welcome, {0}!
Window.Installer.Welcome.Description: Lets get you set up with Umbra.
Window.Installer.Welcome.Text:
Thank you for choosing Umbra!

A lot has changed under the hood with this version, and we are excited to show you what we have in store for you. If you were already using Umbra, you might need to reconfigure some widget icon and text alignments in order for things to look like the way they were.

Please take a moment to go through the following steps to get started.
Window.Installer.Backup.Title: Backup your existing profile?
Window.Installer.Backup.Description: Do you want to backup your existing profile?
Window.Installer.Backup.Text: A lot has changed in version 3 of Umbra, which may cause your existing profile to no longer work as expected. It is recommended to backup your existing profile before proceeding with the installation or making any further customizations.
Window.Installer.Backup.Checkbox.Label: Yes, backup my current profile.
Window.Installer.Backup.Checkbox.Descrip: This will create a copy of your current config profile with the name "Umbra v2 Backup". You can find it under the Config Profiles section in the settings window.
Window.Installer.Prefill.Title: Toolbar Widget Setup
Window.Installer.Prefill.Description: Do you want to prefill the toolbar with some widgets?
Window.Installer.Prefill.Text:
Umbra comes with a set of default widgets that can be added to the toolbar. You can choose to add them now, or skip this step and add them later.

You can always add or remove widgets from the toolbar later in the settings.
Window.Installer.Prefill.Yes: Yes, I would like a prefilled toolbar!
Window.Installer.Prefill.Yes.Hint: This will overwrite your current toolbar configuration.
Window.Installer.Prefill.No: No, I want to set it up myself.
Window.Installer.Prefill.No.Hint: This will leave the toolbar as-is. You can manage widgets in Umbra's Settings window.
Window.Installer.Prefill.NoToolbar: I don't want to use the toolbar
Window.Installer.Prefill.NoToolbar.Hint: This completely disables the toolbar feature. You can always enable it again later in Umbra's Settings window.
Window.Installer.Prefill.ClickNextToConf: Click Next to confirm your choice.
Window.Installer.Configure.Title: Toolbar Configuration
Window.Installer.Configure.Description: Lets set up the toolbar behavior.
Window.Installer.Configure.Position.Desc: Where do you want the toolbar to be displayed?
Window.Installer.Finish.Title: All done, {0}!
Window.Installer.Finish.Description: You are all set up and ready to go!
Window.Installer.Finish.Text:
You can open Umbra's Settings window by typing "/umbra" in the chat window to customize everything to your hearts desire. If you have any questions or feedback, please feel free to reach out to us on Discord.

Thank you for using Umbra!
Window.Installer.Finish.OpenSettings: Open the Umbra Settings window afterwards.
Window.Installer.Footer.Description: You can always open this window via Umbra's Settings window later.
